text: Casimir Marie Ange Oyé-Mba (20 April 1942 – 16 September 2021) was a Gabonese politician. He was Governor of the Bank of Central African States (BEAC) from 1978 to 1990. Oyé-Mba was Prime Minister of Gabon from 3 May 1990 to 2 November 1994.Nancy Ellen Lawler, Gabon: Year in Review 1994, Britannica.com. He also was Minister of State for Foreign Affairs from 1994 to 1999, Minister of State for Planning from 1999 to 2007, and Minister of State for Mines and Oil from 2007 to 2009. Oyé-Mba died on 16 September 2021 in Paris from COVID-19 at the age of 79.: Casimir Oyé Mba est mort à Paris à 79 ans", Direct Info Gabon, 16 September 2021. ==References== Category:1942 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Prime Ministers of Gabon Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Paris
title: Casimir Oyé-Mba
